11#ifndef MODULES_AUDIO_PROCESSING_AEC3_RENDER_SIGNAL_ANALYZER_H_
12#define MODULES_AUDIO_PROCESSING_AEC3_RENDER_SIGNAL_ANALYZER_H_
13
14#include <algorithm>
15#include <array>
16#include <cstddef>
17
18#include "absl/types/optional.h"
19#include "api/audio/echo_canceller3_config.h"
20#include "modules/audio_processing/aec3/aec3_common.h"
21#include "modules/audio_processing/aec3/render_buffer.h"
22#include "rtc_base/checks.h"
23#include "rtc_base/constructor_magic.h"
24
25namespace webrtc {
26
27// Provides functionality for analyzing the properties of the render signal.
28class RenderSignalAnalyzer {
29 public:
30 explicit RenderSignalAnalyzer(const EchoCanceller3Config& config);
31 ~RenderSignalAnalyzer();
32
33 // Updates the render signal analysis with the most recent render signal.
34 void Update(const RenderBuffer& render_buffer,
35 const absl::optional<size_t>& delay_partitions);
36
37 // Returns true if the render signal is poorly exciting.
38 bool PoorSignalExcitation() const {
39 RTC_DCHECK_LT(2, narrow_band_counters_.size());
40 return std::any_of(narrow_band_counters_.begin(),
41 narrow_band_counters_.end(),
42 [](size_t a) { return a > 10; });
43 }
44
45 // Zeros the array around regions with narrow bands signal characteristics.
46 void MaskRegionsAroundNarrowBands(
47 std::array<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1>* v) const;
48
49 absl::optional<int> NarrowPeakBand() const { return narrow_peak_band_; }
50
51 private:
52 const int strong_peak_freeze_duration_;
53 std::array<size_t, kFftLengthBy2 - 1> narrow_band_counters_;
54 absl::optional<int> narrow_peak_band_;
55 size_t narrow_peak_counter_;
56
57 RTC_DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN(RenderSignalAnalyzer);
58};
59
60} // namespace webrtc
61
62#endif // MODULES_AUDIO_PROCESSING_AEC3_RENDER_SIGNAL_ANALYZER_H_
63
